page.title: 01TARRINGTON
page.content: Tarrington lies equidistant between Hereford and Ledbury on the A438. Most of the land lies between 55m and 75m,there is a small outcrop of hilly ground to the South of the area which reaches 175m.The land is chiefly used for grassgrowing for the dairy farms. Other crops include apples for cider,hops for beer,peas,seed rape and cereals.The grass is usually cut for silage though haymaking is still carried out. It is a thinly populated area with about 550,mainly centred in Tarrington village,Yarkhill or Ashperton. The number of farmworker cotttages has declined rapidly over the past ten years,due to mechanisation and the need for fewer permanent farm staff. Most workers commute to the neighbouring towns of Hereford,Ross, Malvern and Ledbury.
